com.arm.mbed.cloud.sdk.lowlevel.pelionclouddevicemanagement.api

Interface DeviceSecurityDeveloperClassCertificatesApi


  • public interface DeviceSecurityDeveloperClassCertificatesApi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      retrofit2.Call<DeveloperCertificateResponseData> createDeveloperCertificate(DeveloperCertificateRequestData body)
      Create a new developer certificate to connect to the bootstrap server.
      retrofit2.Call<DeveloperCertificateResponseData> getDeveloperCertificate(java.lang.String developerCertificateId)
      Fetch an existing developer certificate to connect to the bootstrap server.

    • Method Detail

      • createDeveloperCertificate

        @POST(value="v3/developer-certificates")
retrofit2.Call<DeveloperCertificateResponseData> createDeveloperCertificate(@Body
                                                                                                                      DeveloperCertificateRequestData body)
        Create a new developer certificate to connect to the bootstrap server. Create a developer certificate (a certificate that can be flashed to multiple devices to connect to the bootstrap server). **Note:** The number of developer certificates allowed per account is limited. Please see [Using your own certificate authority](../provisioning-process/using-CA.html). **Example:** ``` curl -X POST http://api.us-east-1.mbedcloud.com/v3/developer-certificates \\ -H \"Authorization: Bearer <api_key>\" \\ -H \"content-type: application/json\" \\ -d { \"name\": \"<certificate_name>\", \"description\": \"<certificate_description>\" } ```
        Parameters:
        body - (required)
        Returns:
        Call<DeveloperCertificateResponseData>

      • getDeveloperCertificate

        @GET(value="v3/developer-certificates/{developerCertificateId}")
retrofit2.Call<DeveloperCertificateResponseData> getDeveloperCertificate(@Path(value="developerCertificateId",encoded=true)
                                                                                                                                           java.lang.String developerCertificateId)
        Fetch an existing developer certificate to connect to the bootstrap server. Return an existing developer certificate (a certificate that can be flashed to multiple devices to connect to bootstrap server). **Example:** ``` curl -X GET http://api.us-east-1.mbedcloud.com/v3/developer-certificates/THE_CERTIFICATE_ID \\ -H \"Authorization: Bearer <api_key>\" ```
        Parameters:
        developerCertificateId - A unique identifier for the developer certificate. (required)
        Returns:
        Call<DeveloperCertificateResponseData>
